alert.note: Alert for Lancaster; York (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 12 at 3:02AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Lancaster and York. * WHEN...From 2 PM EDT this afternoon through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Hourly rainfall amounts needed to elevate the risk for flash flooding are lowest across parts of York and Lancaster counties and only around 1.2 to 1.4 inches. Just a few thunderstorms moving over the same area could easily produce these rainfall amounts. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
